name: David Letterman
monologue: The “Share A Ride” program in New York City begins today. New Yorkers can actually share a cab. I saw a couple of New Yorkers sharing a cab this morning. One took the radio, one took the tires.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Things You Don't Want To Hear From A Guy In Your Bobsled

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Sarah Palin is shopping a reality show. She quit as governor to follow in the footsteps of Ray J and the Kardashians.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: New York Gov. David Paterson lied under oath about getting free Yankees tickets for the World Series last Fall. Paterson, who is legally blind, maintains that he didn’t even know he was at a Yankees game.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Tiger Woods’ caddy, Steve Williams, said he had no idea Tiger was fooling around with other women. He said he was disappointed in Tiger but is standing by him as  a friend, and the source of all of his income.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: The only caddy that should be disappointed is the one that Tiger drove into a tree.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: President Obama had his annual physical last week. While the colonoscopy didn’t reveal any polyps, they did find three MSNBC reporters and a New York Times columnist.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: General Motors announced that they’re recalling 1.3 million compact cars in North America to address a power steering problem. Apparently, since President Obama took over the company, all of the cars are veering to the left.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: In the Democratic gubernatorial primary, Texas voters overwhelmingly nominated former Houston mayor Bill White over Pakistani-born businessman Farouk Shami. Who could have seen that coming?

name: Jay Leno
monologue: According to a Vanity Fair poll, 22 percent of Americans say they completely forgive Tiger Woods for cheating on his wife. The other 78 percent were women.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Sarah Palin has been shopping around her own reality show. Of course, any reality show about Sarah Palin will have to compete with that other reality show about Sarah Palin — “the news.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Samsung just came out with this new refrigerator that has built-in Internet and a screen on the outside so you can display family photos and recipes. Or for $2,000 less, you can buy a magnet.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: There’s a new trend in skydiving called “Skyaking,” where people jump out of planes in a kayak. Or as Southwest would call it, a "connecting flight."

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: There’s a new vending machine in Japan that can wash, rinse, and blow-dry your dog in 30 minutes.  They have the same exact thing in China, but it doubles as a snack machine.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: It’s not a great day for California State Sen. Roy Ashburn. He was pulled over for a DUI and it turns out that he was drinking in a gay nightclub. All I can say is “thank you,” Sen. Ashburn, because until now, it’s been a very slow week.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Ashburn voted against every single gay rights measure. Maybe he was at the night club to protest the gay lifestyle. However, he tested positive for “Appletini.”

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: There is a theory that Ashburn could be a closeted homosexual, and he may also be a hypocrite. Hypocrisy at this level is like seeing Mel Gibson at a synagogue.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: This guy is making California’s government look like a joke and that’s clearly Schwarzenegger’s job.
